clueNetwork
Class ClientSocket

java.lang.Object
  clueNetwork.ClientSocket

public class ClientSocket
extends Object

Class semantics and roles:
The ClientSocket is the main utility for communicating over a socket connection. this includes board updates, guesses and accusations.
ANY usage of the socket is over a ClientSocket object.

Information maintenance:
Creation: The ClientSocket is created on the server-side when a connection is established with a client process. On the client-side, a ClientSocket is created when the user chooses to try to connect to a server instance.
Deletion: The ClientSocket is deleted when the connection is lost.

Author:
Michael Philippone (Class Skeletons & Code), Erich Schudt (Testing and Drivers)

Method Detail

connect

public boolean connect(String address,
                       int port)
Deprecated. this should only ever accept an already-connected socket, like the one from ServerListener. So use the one that takes in a socket as its argument

Purpose: The connect method connects to a TCP port at another computer.
Precondition: There is not connection, there is an endpoint ready to hold a TCP session
Postcondition: There is a stateful, persistent TCP connection established and the properties endPointAddress and endPointPort are set to the given values

Parameters:
address - the address of the other endpoint in the TCP communication
port - the port of the other endpoint in the TCP communication
Returns:
boolean true if the send was successful, false if not

connect

public boolean connect(Socket sktIn)
Purpose: This connect method assigns this class' socket a reference to an active one from ServerListener's initial detection of a connection.
Precondition: There may or may not be an active socket referenced by this.sk
Postcondition: There is a socket referenced by this.sk

Parameters:
sktIn - the socket to reference by this.sk
Returns:
boolean true if the send was successful, false if not

read

public String read()
Method returns data sent over the socket.
Precondition: There is a connection, the other endpoint loads data onto the socket
Postcondition: The socket is in its ready state

Returns:
the value of the data received from the socket as a string, or null if it fails

send

public boolean send(String message)
Method sends the bytes corresponding to the given message on the socket.
Precondition: The socket is in the ready state, there is a message to be sent
Postcondition: The message has been sent, the socket is in the ready state

Parameters:
message - the string formatted message to send as bytes on the socket
Returns:
boolean true if the send was successful, false if not

close

public boolean close()
Method closes the socket connection on call. Returns true if successful.
Precondition: Socket exists in the ready state
Postcondition: socket connection to endpoint is terminated / closed

Returns:
boolean true if the disconnect was successful, false if it was not

getEndPointAddress

public String getEndPointAddress()
Purpose: Get the address this socket is communicating to.

Returns:
the IP address string of the other computer on the socket

getEndPointPort

public int getEndPointPort()
Purpose: Get the port this socket is communicating on.

Returns:
the integer port number of the other computer on the socket

getSocket

public Socket getSocket()
Purpose: Get the whole socket instance from this class.

Returns:
the socket instance maintained in this class
